avalancheActivity.comment: Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France The wind slabs represent the main danger. Avalanches can in isolated cases be released, mostly by large loads. This applies in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, as well as in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain especially above approximately 2400 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France Wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France The wind slabs represent the main danger. Avalanches can in isolated cases be released, mostly by large loads. This applies in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, as well as in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain especially above approximately 2600 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France Wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In these regions from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, at elevated altitudes. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. These avalanche prone locations are to be found at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack above approximately 2600 m.
In some places wind slabs are lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs require caution, especially along the border with France.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 2400 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At higher altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
